required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics (PK) Study of Epinephrine Inhalation Aerosol in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II Study Epinephrine Inhalation Aerosol USP, an HFA-MDI Clinical Study-B for Assessment of Pharmacokinetics

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the pharmacokinetic profile of Armstrong's proposed Epinephrine Inhalation Aerosol USP, an HFA-MDI (E004), in healthy male and female adult volunteers. Safety of E004 will also be evaluated, under augmented dose conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a randomized, evaluator-blind, single dose, three-arm, crossover, PK study, to be conducted in ~18 healthy, male and female, adult volunteers. PK will be studied at two dose strengths (Arm T1 and Arm T2). A currently marketed, non-labeled, Epinephrine CFC-MDI will be used as a Reference Control (Arm C).
- At the Screening Visit and the beginning of each Study Visit, each subject will be trained on the correct self-administration of MDI. The following three randomized treatments will be self-administered, at three Study Visits:
- Treatment T1: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004(125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine;
- Treatment T2: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine;
- Treatment C: Ten (10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation, totaling 2.2 mg of epinephrine base equivalent).
- PK blood samples will be taken from a vein at scheduled time points.
- Safety parameters and adverse drug events, if any, will be monitored and documented at each study visit. An End-of-Study (EOS) safety evaluation will be conducted.

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Concentration (C0) of Labeled Epinephrine Total Epinephrine
primary_outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at Baseline (prior to dosing) in each treatment period following a specified washout period (3-14 days), and were analyzed using an established analysis method. Baseline concentration (C0) is the concentration of epinephrine measured in the plasma at this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to 6 Hours Post-dose (AUC[0-6])
primary_outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at 0 (baseline), 5, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, and 360 minutes post-dose in each treatment period and were analyzed using an established analysis method. Area under the curve from time zero to 6 hours post-dose (AUC[0-6]) was calculated using the trapezoidal rule.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Concentration (Cmax) for Total Epinephrine From Time Zero to 6 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at 0 (baseline), 5, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, and 360 minutes post-dose in each treatment period and were analyzed using an established analysis method. Peak (maximum) concentration (Cmax) is the highest concentration of epinephrine measured in plasma during the treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Peak Concentration (Tmax) for Total Epinephrine
primary_outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at 0 (baseline), 5, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, and 360 minutes post-dose in each treatment period and were analyzed using an established analysis method. tmax is the amount of time it takes for epinephrine to reach peak concentration in plasma during the treatment period.

Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at 0 (baseline), 5, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, and 360 minutes post-dose in each treatment period and were analyzed using an established analysis method. Half-life (t1/2) is the amount of time it takes for epinephrine decrease to half the peak concentration in plasma during the treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration vs. Time for Total Epinephrine From Time Zero to 6 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at 0 (baseline), 5, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120, 180, 240, and 360 minutes post-dose in each treatment period and were analyzed using an established analysis method.

secondary_outcome.description: Subject vital signs, i.e., blood pressure and heart rate, were measured prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
Subject vital signs, i.e., blood pressure and heart rate, were measured prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
Subject vital signs, i.e., blood pressure and heart rate, were measured prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
Subject QT and QTc Intervals were recorded using a 12-Lead ECG prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
Subject QT and QTc Intervals were recorded using a 12-Lead ECG prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
Blood samples used to measure subject serum glucose and potassium levels were collected prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes post-dose.
Blood samples used to measure subject serum glucose and potassium levels were collected prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes post-dose.

Subjects evaluated hand tremor experiences using a scale from 0 to 3 (0: No tremor; 1: Mild, perceivable; 2: Moderate, observable; and 3: Severe, interfering with hand activities). Hand tremors were evaluated prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Physical Examination
secondary_outcome.description: Physical examinations were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS physical examination compared to the Screening Visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Laboratory Tests
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory tests (CBC, serum comprehensive metabolic panel, urinalysis, and urinary pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential) were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS laboratory tests compared to the Screening Visit.

arm_group.description: Active comparator arm utilizing marketed Primatene Mist with CFC propellant at the labeled dose.
T1 is HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol 125 mcg/inhalation
HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 160 mcg/inhalation

intervention.description: HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 125 mcg/inhalation, 10 inhalations
HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 160 mcg/inhalation, 10 inhalations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from a specialty clinic in Cypress, CA between 04/29/2010 and 05/27/2010
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 38 subjects were screened, 24 subjects passed screening, consented and were randomized for participation in the study. The IRB approval date was 04/29/2010, the last subject was screened on 05/27/2010.

group.title: C, T1, T2
group.description: Subjects received one of the three treatments during each study visit, separated by a washout period of 3-14 days. Visit 1: Treatment C: Ten (10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation), totaling 2.20 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min; Visit 2: Treatment T1: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004 (125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min; Visit 3: Treatment T2: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min.

group.title: C, T2, T1
group.description: Subjects received one of the three treatments during each study visit, separated by a washout period of 3-14 days. Visit 1: Treatment C: Ten (10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation), totaling 2.20 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min; Visit 2: Treatment T2: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min; Visit 3: Treatment T1: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004 (125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine, in 5 min.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Baseline Concentration (C0) of Labeled Epinephrine Total Epinephrine
outcome.description: Patient PK blood samples were taken from a vein in a hand or arm via indwelling heparin-anticoagulated IV catheters, or by venipunctures at Baseline (prior to dosing) in each treatment period following a specified washout period (3-14 days), and were analyzed using an established analysis method. Baseline concentration (C0) is the concentration of epinephrine measured in the plasma at this time point.
outcome.population: Patients who: 1) have taken the valid pre-dose baseline PK sample 2) have correctly taken the randomized study-drug treatment 3) have at least four of the five post-dose PK measurements between 5 and 60 min post-dose available and 4) have a minimum of eight of the ten post-dose PK measurements for the entire 6 hour post-dose PK sampling period.

group.title: Treatment T1
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004 (125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment T2
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment C
group.description: Ten(10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation), totaling 2.20 mg of epinephrine

outcome.title: Vital Signs: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)
outcome.description: Subject vital signs, i.e., blood pressure and heart rate, were measured prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

outcome.title: Vital Signs: Heart Rate (HR)
outcome.description: Subject vital signs, i.e., blood pressure and heart rate, were measured prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

group.title: Treatment T1
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004 (125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment T2
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment C
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation), totaling 2.20 mg of epinephrine

outcome.title: ECG: QT Interval
outcome.description: Subject QT and QTc Intervals were recorded using a 12-Lead ECG prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes after dosing during the study visit.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

outcome.title: Hand Tremor Scores
outcome.description: Subjects evaluated hand tremor experiences using a scale from 0 to 3 (0: No tremor; 1: Mild, perceivable; 2: Moderate, observable; and 3: Severe, interfering with hand activities). Hand tremors were evaluated prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes post-dose.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

group.title: Treatment T1
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the low dose E004 (125 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.25 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment T2
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of the high dose E004 (160 mcg/inhalation), totaling 1.60 mg of epinephrine

group.title: Treatment C
group.description: Ten (10) inhalations of Epinephrine CFC-MDI (220 mcg/inhalation), totaling 2.20 mg of epinephrine

measure.title: Hand Tremor Scores
measure.description: Subjects evaluated hand tremor experiences using a scale from 0 to 3 (0: No tremor; 1: Mild, perceivable; 2: Moderate, observable; and 3: Severe, interfering with hand activities). Hand tremors were evaluated prior to study drug dosing (baseline) and up to 360 minutes post-dose.
measure.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Physical Examination
outcome.description: Physical examinations were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS physical examination compared to the Screening Visit.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment. The Arm/Group is presented as one group because subjects would have received all 3 different study drug treatments prior to EOS due to the crossover study design.

group.title: Randomized Subjects
group.description: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Physical Examination
measure.description: Physical examinations were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS physical examination compared to the Screening Visit.
measure.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment. The Arm/Group is presented as one group because subjects would have received all 3 different study drug treatments prior to EOS due to the crossover study design.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Laboratory Tests
outcome.description: Laboratory tests (CBC, serum comprehensive metabolic panel, urinalysis, and urinary pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential) were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS laboratory tests compared to the Screening Visit.
outcome.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment. The Arm/Group is presented as one group because subjects would have received all 3 different study drug treatments prior to EOS due to the crossover study design.

group.title: Randomized Subjects

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Significant Changes in Laboratory Tests
measure.description: Laboratory tests (CBC, serum comprehensive metabolic panel, urinalysis, and urinary pregnancy test for women of childbearing potential) were performed as a part of Screening and End-of-Study (EOS) procedures. This outcome is a count of the number of subjects that showed a clinically significant change in the EOS laboratory tests compared to the Screening Visit.
measure.population: Subjects who have taken any amount of study drug treatment. The Arm/Group is presented as one group because subjects would have received all 3 different study drug treatments prior to EOS due to the crossover study design.

reported_events.time_frame: All patients were closely monitored for any incidence of adverse events by the investigators during the entire study period.

group.title: Treatment T1
group.description: T1 is HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol 125 mcg/inhalation epinephrine inhalation aerosol : HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 125 mcg/inhalation, 10 inhalations

group.title: Treatment T2
group.description: HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 160 mcg/inhalation epinephrine inhalation aerosol : HFA propelled epinephrine inhalation aerosol, 160 mcg/inhalation, 10 inhalations

group.title: Treatment C
group.description: Active comparator arm utilizing marketed Primatene Mist with CFC propellant at the labeled dose. epinephrine inhalation aerosol : Single dose 220 mcg/inhalation, 10 inhalations

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI is to maintain all information, data, inventions and discoveries disclosed by the Sponsor in confidence unless that information was in public domain at time of disclosure or becomes part of the public domain or is published through no fault of the PI or Institution, or was in the possession of the PI or Institution at time of disclosure and was not acquired from Sponsor under any obligation of confidentiality or is produced pursuant to a validly issued subpoena.
